intro: Erigeron linearifolius, commonly known as narrow-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It has slender, linear leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Erigeron linearifolius is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
